column5: Ihope you feel well soon gary and you recover   in time for the walleye oprner in a few weeks...get well soon    cheers
Thats some scary stuff Gary.Listen to the doctors and we'll see you in Amy in June... Joe
Glad you are doing well Gary. One tough ol' dude you are. Hope to see you at Lakair as well  . Take care.
Wow !   who'da figured eh?  Remember...Easy Does It my friend...you got two months to Lakair so rest up and get well...  Maribeth sends her best wishes also...
Dang Gary!!! I hope everything turns out ok! The best of Luck all the utmost well wishes!
Please get well soon Garyv! It is good to see you back! I hope that you are feeling well soon!
take it easy Gary and hope you have a speedy recovery,i knew those Brontisaurus burgers were big,soon time to be chasing those Huron fish, Brian
Get well soon Gary! Nothing like having a perfect idiot! I feel the need for some anul probing myself.
Gary, very good to hear that things are going well after surgery. Keep up the energy level you'll be up and out fishing in no time!
Hey Gary, get well soon! There's a Brontosaurus Burger here with your name on it at the next London GTG -Brian

Glad to hear you doing fine,and yes ,I'm sure it's the fishin' and hunting that keeps us in shape.They were all amazed when I got out of bed after 3 days and home bound in 10......It's got to be the lifesyle......Keep it up....TC and tight lines.....Chuck....
You should have called me Gary I would have "unclogged you". Get well soon   Art
Cripes!  Sorry to hear you had such a rough go, But glad to hear your on the mend. Tace care,
Gary get well soon, you'll be on the water before you know it!   Gerritt.
sounds like you are doing well.....  there is something to be said about being an active outdoorsey type
Got to sneak down to the PC again this morning.  Just want to thank all of you for the kind words as well as words of encouragement.  Hope fully I'll be back full time between Thursday and Monday.
Get well soon Gary
....Good to see you're all fixed Gary and on the mend.
It's great that you're doing so well and that you'll soon be on the water.
Good to hear that you are on the mend....speeding recovery!!!  Bly

I've missed the board for the last 10 days or so.  On Friday 10 days previous I thought I was getting the flu, but by mid evening it was without a doubt one bad case. I managed to make it to Monday and when I went to see our doctor and was told you most likely have a blocked bowel and get to the hospital now.  My wife drove me right down and for the next 3 days they tried to fix the problem with medicine which was not working so Thursday last I had surgery at 7:00 PM to remove the bad section.  Now it's Monday and I'm hoping to be home by Friday.   I was lucky to find this PC in the surgery waiting room so I thought I would take advantage and post.  I was told there must be something to being an active outdoorsey type ( yeah I know there's no such word ) as when 9 hours after the operation they had me walking in intensive care without much diffuculity. They told me being able to have the stamina to do this that shortly after surgery is not the norm......so keep fishing and hunting!
GET WELL SOON!
WOW Yer one lucky fella and in great shape I would say.  Easy does it,no rush,lots of time to get fishing and hunting in Gary.  TC.
Wow Gary, so sorry to hear that, but I'm also glad to hear you are on the mend.  Now your wife can never tell you that you can't go fishing  Be strong bud.  Thinking about you,  Joey
Take care of yourself, Gary. The board will still be hear when you get back.

Wow!!! Same thing happened to my mother last year.  Thought it was flu or food poisoning ended up being a twisted bowel/blockage.  They hoped it would resolve itself with rest and medication, but when it didn't it was a quick operation to fix it.  Glad to hear you came through it with flying colours!  Get well soon!
Ditto to what everyone else said and take care of yourself gary.
Get well soon Gary... although it sounds like your on the right path to recovery! Bass season is still a ways off, so rest up and you'll be boatin them soon enough! HH
You'll be back on the water in no time.  Hope you're on your way to a full recovery.  Appreciate the update and I'm sure the others do as well.   Keep us posted as to your progress.
Get well Gary, you'll be good to go for the season.
Helps to be such a tough old bird! The weather is crummy so you aren't missin da fishin! Get well soon Gary!
Glad you got through it good, Gary. Look after yourself.
keep on trucking bud....
Wish the best for ya ...you will be back to fishing in no time ...

Gary I know how you feel.  About five years ago I had to get opened up beacause of a blockage.  I was in the hospital for four days after the operation.  Two weeks later I was in moose camp with my buddies.  It was a great I never had to lift a hand to help get our animals out.  Hope you get well soon.
Take it easy Gary and rest up for the upcoming season. Thats quite the operation to have to go thru so give it time.  Good Luck  Mike

When I hadn't seen you around for so long Gary, I fgured your musta slipped away to the Sunshine State or something.  Good to hear your recovering so well, just be sure your ready for Lakair in June, Amy needs you to drive the boat.  Take care of yerself Gary and do what the doc tells ya !!
get well and take care of yourself
Take care and like Lew said...do what the Doctors tell yah. We'll be looking for you healthy and ready to fish come Lakair!
Really glad to here the report is a good one! get well soon!
Hope you're up and about soon Gary.  Jim
Get well soon Gary, don't push yourself too hard.  Cheers, Jen
Glad to hear things turned out well Gary. Take care and look forward to seeing/meeting you at Lakair.

Good to hear that your up and about Gary. I am sorry to hear about the fact that you required surgery for this and Charmaine is now pointing out that....She wishes you an even speedier recovery. Take care Bud.........  (We wont be making Lakair this year due to the new house so, you , as others will be missed) Take care my friend.
Good to hear from you Gary. Get well soon its just about time for another London swill.
